course_description: This course introduces the critical role of the Korean language in culture and society, focusing on how language reflects, reinforces, and shapes the cultural values, standards, and structure of society.Topics include language policies/contacts,  dialects, gender differences, and honorifics. Korean literacy or knowledge of Korean alphabet is necessary.
sections: Class Nbr: 4015, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: S. Huh, Status: Open
